str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Probably of Hebrew origin; Lazarus, the name of two Israelites.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pule; a gate-way, door-way of a building or city; by implication, a portal or vestibule.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To afflict with sores; pass: To be afflicted with sores. From helkos; to cause to ulcerate, i.e. be ulcerous.
